data.title: AASCTF Kaysone Phomvihane project flyer: Improving the employability and soft skills of a growing workforce through smart tools
meta_keywords: ASEAN Australia Smart Cities Trust Fund
data.meta_description: In Kaysone Phomvihane, Lao People’s Democratic Republic, the ASEAN Australia Smart Cities Trust Fund (AASCTF) has been helping to conceptualize an employment service platform and develop an educational mobile application that will address the skills supply-demand gap in the city. This project flyer presents a brief background of the challenge and the two phases of
data.text:
In Kaysone Phomvihane, Lao People’s Democratic Republic, the ASEAN Australia Smart Cities Trust Fund (AASCTF) has been helping to conceptualize an employment service platform and develop an educational mobile application that will address the skills supply-demand gap in the city. This project flyer presents a brief background of the challenge and the two phases of interventions supported. Both aim to facilitate the school to work transition of Kaysone’s youth and tertiary graduates so that they will have the essential skills and job application and onboarding know-how to thrive in the labor market.

The AASCTF is financed by the Australian Government through the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade, managed by the Asian Development Bank, and implemented by Ramboll. For the Kaysone project, Ramboll led the implementation of Phase 1 while ADB led Phase 2.
